text: Jean-Baptiste Robert Lindet (2 May 1746 in Bernay, Eure â€“ 17 February 1825 in Paris) was a French politician of the Revolutionary period. His brother, Robert Thomas Lindet, became a constitutional bishop and member of the National Convention.
